item.title: Senior Consultant/Modeler, Decision Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Decision Science team is a central hub of data science expertise within Personal and Business Banking, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms to truly revolutionize personalization to drive client experience. The Senior Consultant/Modeler ensures that sound analytical methods and processes are followed and predictive models are built on sound data samples. As a Senior Consultant you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. This position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model building, model governance and model performance monitoring and other analysis to help optimize the effectiveness and profitability of projects, marketing campaigns, pricing, contracts and other business decisions across our products. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from Products, Segments, Marketing to Channels and Risk. You will work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. The position will also act as a main point of contact for communicating effectively to Product Business partners requirements, questions and concerns related to all models and related model performance.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 day per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problem leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.

  • Modeler: Participate in model development by conducting detailed quantitative analysis work to support the model development. Support deploying statistics and machine learning models in development and production environments. Work closely with senior modelers to facilitate effective dissemination of model related documents and model governance and model performance to business partners.

  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.

  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as SAS, R or Python. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages in SAS EG and Enterprise Miner.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in Master or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-12-31

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Business Decisions, Communication, Data Analysis, Data Science, Predictive Analytics, Profitability

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Data & Analytics team is a central hub of analytics expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. As a Senior Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from products, segments, marketing to channels, risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problem leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.

  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generating and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.  

  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Hive, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as Python, SAS or R. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages such as SAS Enterprise Miner, NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-Learn, Keras or PyTorch.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in Master or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Analytical Skills (Inactive), Application Programming Interface (API), Artificial Intelligence (Inactive), Attention to Detail (Inactive), Big Data, Building Effective Teams (Inactive), Building Partnerships (Inactive), Data Analysis, Data Science, Delivering Results (Inactive), Financial Modeling, Instilling Trust (Inactive), Machine Learning, Managing Relationships (Inactive), Software Programming (SQL) (Inactive)

item.title: Director, Strategic Development, ADA
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Director, Strategic Development, Architecture, Data & Analytics (ADA) is responsible for developing and driving the strategic direction across ADA. You will be working collaboratively with business stakeholders, technology partners and vendors leading cross-functional efforts to put in place strategic transformation and integration activities in order to build roadmaps and action plans for architecture, data, governance and analytics solutions. The Director manages relationships with senior business partners, maintaining continuous business communications with them to proactively plan and deliver business value.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop ADA Strategy: including the strategic roadmap for Architecture, Data & Analytics with a focus on building leadership in support of the continued transformation of data, analytics, governance and architecture solutions. Design and deliver robust business cases through their required governance lifecycle and report on the portfolio initiatives to the Investment Operations Board (IOB) including benefits realization. Manage pipeline and funding to determine prioritization for new initiatives by developing a framework to monitor, forecast and prioritize the overall work/portfolio of projects for ADA

  • Thought Leadership: Be a thought leader in transformation initiatives to optimize ADA’s capability, efficiency and effectiveness that would lead to key competitive advantages of our bank in the future. Leveraging a strong understanding of the industry, assessing market opportunities to establish a forward looking view that positions each team within ADA for sustained success with a focus on innovation and simplification

  • Relationship Management: Directly partner with business and technology partners to develop roadmaps and plans for ADA strategies; identify opportunities to leverage technology to meet business goals, increase efficiency and create robust platforms that support operational excellence. Liaise with third party vendors regarding potential solutions, assessment opportunities or proof of concepts

  • Strong Leadership – Well-developed management and leadership skills sufficient to achieve results within a matrix organization, including the ability to influence at a senior level. Lead and coach a high performing team of individuals. Direct, motivate, and develop the team, maximizing their contributions and professional growth. Share knowledge and collaborate to come up with effective solutions to problems.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience in developing imaginative solutions and new ways of thinking about situations, problems and opportunities. Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures required to develop best practice, knowledge-based business systems and strategic capability. Comprehensive knowledge of financial services practices and principles sufficient to analyze and interpret complex concepts and apply these in innovative ways. Understanding of mission critical delivery systems, including business resumption and contingency. Ability to apply these competencies within an integrated and complex business environment involving multiple vendors and/ or solutions

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes through your excellent problem solving and decision making abilities. You demonstrate team player qualities through your ability to lead and motivate others. 

  • You are a bold and accountable leader. You have experience developing and implementing strategic team goals. You have experience coaching employees and driving successful team performance.

  • You can demonstrate experience in strategy development, business case management and agile methodologies

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You have the ability to analyze data and reports with the goal of developing potential opportunities. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Business management, Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study, MBA is an asset

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do. 

  • You embrace and champion change. You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best, in a fast paced environment with a high degree of change and multiple priorities 

  • You’re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create shared vision.  

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. 

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Cards Analytics & Insights the Senior Manager – Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting the Cards business within Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – you will combine analytical work with domain knowledge to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends; proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 7th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Analytics Specialist, Fraud Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Analytics Consultant you will be doing ongoing data analysis associated with rules management within CIBC’s fraud mitigation systems.

You will conduct large data extraction and manipulations using SAS for fraud reporting. As well as, assist the team in the development and application of complex statistical concepts/theories and predictions including cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models  and sampling.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking –Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.

  • Data Management – Creation and maintenance of SAS and SQL programs to access a decision support data repository.  Database management/querying, and computer programming/software expertise.

  • Communication Skills–  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Director, Treasury Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing 

The Director will support Senior Director(s) of Treasury Analytics to conduct analysis to develop advanced statistical models to accurately predict how customer behavior affects retail product cash-flows and the use of embedded options; apply financial engineering techniques as needed for valuation. The Director is also expected to implement/apply advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, back-testing,  & risk factor simulation and to interpret and explain any resulting output.

How You’ll Succeed

Consumer Behavior Analytics - Lead the development and modeling for customer behavior used in Treasury Analytics parameter review. Provide subject matter expertise and develop procedures for back testing cash-flow models to assess their validity for projecting cash-flows and recommend improvement to such models. Apply statistical models to forecast cash-flows and quantify forecast uncertainties. Conduct back-testing and to recommend updated consumer behavior parameters.  Present models to stakeholders and gain their support and model acceptance.

Quantitative Analysis - Apply sophisticated mathematical modeling, processes or algorithms to conduct analysis & risk factor simulation. Apply standards and protocols to ensure output is correct and reproducible.  Document assumptions, explain analytical methods, and interpret the results.

Financial/Derivative Analytics - Support the management of Cash-flow modeling books. Conduct back-testing and recommending risk rebalancing in the cash-flow modeling books to maintain cash-flow modeling risk at minimal levels.  Implement and lead development of analytics for cashflow models, pricing and hedging of fixed income derivatives, market risk measurement, ALM and balance sheet management, portfolio management and optimization. Develop analytics/methodologies for transfer pricing new retail products and assess new and existing retail product profitability. Analyze, interpret and explain cash-flow modeling P/L and risk drivers.

Data Science - Independently design and perform moderately complex data preparation tasks using data mining methods; null value replacement, imputation, joins and unions, etc.  Exploratory data analysis including concepts/theories of clustering, dimension reduction, sampling, and Bayesian estimation. The analysis may require creative thinking to overcome limitations in data availability and data quality.  Predictive modeling which include complex statistical concepts/theories and predictions including optimization, clustering, neural networks, logistic regression, multiple decision trees, sampling, and Bayesian estimation. The analysis and modeling may require creative thinking to overcome limitations in data availability and data quality.

Systems and Support - Support the development  and maintenance of incorporating consumer behavior analytics into pricing, risk and mathematical analytics library supporting integration across all Treasury systems and stand-alone useability, and consistency with in-house or 3rd party analytics that are used for Bank-wide  benchmarking to validate pricing or risk. Ensure all analytics and methodologies have been vetted and validated with appropriate approval levels. Ensure operational effectiveness to deliver analytics capabilities.

Who You Are

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

  • You can demonstrate experience in or have a strong theoretical understanding of financial economics, financial mathematics, statistics (advanced GLM, Cox regression), risk management and option modeling techniques. In addition you have strong system and quantitative programming skills using C/C++/Python/R/SQL.  You will also have minimum of 4-5 years of relevant statistical modeling / quant work experience, along with a Masters/Doctoral degree in mathematics, engineering, statistics or related technical subject and work experience in applied mathematical, statistical, or stochastic modeling.  You also have the ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. It is an asset if you have experience in working with banking retail products such as commitments, mortgages or GICs.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2022-01-31

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St., 11th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

C++ Programming Language, Financial Economics, Mathematical Finance, Option Valuation, Python, R Code, Risk Management, Statistical Models, Structured Query Language (SQL)

item.title: Sr Analyst, Risk Platforms
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing:

The position of Sr. Analyst, Risk Platforms works with the Sr. Manager, Risk Platforms to provide specialized knowledge, business/systems analysis and expertise in the completion of approved projects and initiatives in which Risk Analytics and Credit Decisioning (RACD) is a key stakeholder.  The Sr. Analyst represents the interests of RACD by helping to ensure that the lending systems used to manage and mitigate risk continue to function as expected.

How You’ll Succeed:

  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, ask the right questions and listen to ensure requirement completeness.
  • Solution Design - Participate in building client-focused solutions that meet business requirements using either waterfall or Agile methodology. Ensure accuracy of solution design documents including around areas such as scope clarification and quality assurance.
  • Risk Management & Analytics – Collaborate with partners to manage the overall risk profile of the portfolio by analyzing data used in the development and maintenance of risk platforms.  Use data-driven processes to effectively manage system implementations and changes.
  • Communication - Demonstrate well developed verbal, written and presentation skills sufficient to articulate analytic results, options, recommendations and benefits to all levels of management. 

Who You Are:

  • You\'re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a business analyst role within technology projects. It’s an asset if you have experience with CIBC systems used in support of Personal and Small Business lending operations (CLASS, Decision Manager, CBG, Target, Excalibur, COMPASS, Lending BI, EDH) and with Agile methodologies.
  • You have well-developed analytical skills.  Able to conceptualize, research, compile and translate analytical findings into meaningful strategies or recommendations.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers:

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Sr. Finance Data Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Global Process Owner Accounting (GPO) Team is accountable for working to align all Capital Market (CM) strategic initiatives for people, policies and technologies across geographies with a mindset to optimize processes and eliminate inefficiencies and redundancies. You will be leveraging your data analytics background and tools such as Alteryx, Tableau & DevOps to create workflows and visualizations to help management draw insights and aid in strategic decision making. You will contribute to and lead projects to optimize and simplify processes, working with a variety of internal stakeholders including CM Trading, Technology and Operations as well as numerous groups within Finance.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Relationship management –  possess good teamwork, partnership and relationship building skills sufficient to act in a collaborative manner with team members and stakeholders from different backgrounds and experiences. You will liaise daily with Finance, Front Office and other Capital Markets’ stakeholder groups.
  • Accounting and Controls – draw on your controls & governance skill sets to design and implement processes that result in accurate, complete, and timely inputs used throughout Finance. You take a holistic view of problems end to end and develop deep understanding of the current state so you can recommend ways to do things better. You draw on your past experiences to lead significant break investigations and analysis which is then summarized and presented to key stakeholders.
  • Subject Matter Expertise - Provide subject matter expertise (SME) on business analytics serving as the lead on all reporting / data visualization projects to gather reporting and data visualization requirements and develop user reports and dashboards.
  • Data/Reporting - Deliver key design and solution on reporting and dashboarding projects as well to provide thought leadership on data capture and delivery for the overall project.
  • Advisory - Provide advisory and training to Finance users on the adoption and proper use of the business analytics tools.
  • Agility – drive value by integrating, standardizing and sustaining the processes throughout the CIBC. You will help in eliminating process inefficiencies and creating enterprise-wide changes by developing a good understanding of the current state processes, defining the target state, and helping establishing a plan to streamline.

Who You Are

  • You are an experienced data professional. You have 2 or more years of experience as a dashboarding or reporting specialist and 3 years of relevant industry experience. You have comprehensive knowledge of a number of workflow automation or data visualization tools / platforms with the ability to interpret complex business requirements. Practical DevOps, Alteryx & Tableau experience an asset
  • You can demonstrate experience with a strong Capital Markets accounting background in order to support the oversight and governance functions, including enhancement of financial controls across multiple groups.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Business, Finance or Accounting, a certificate in Data Science, or an equal combination of education and industry experience.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration, and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

18 York Street, 10th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Alteryx, Azure Devops, Business Analysis, Capital Markets, Tableau

item.title: Consultant, Business Systems Analysis
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Business Systems Consultant you will be responsible for providing management reporting and business analytics to support IT Senior Management. This includes creating and delivering regular and ad hoc reports as well as conducting analysis to support business decisions and initiatives

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Data Analytics & Reporting: Gather key business metrics that will support management and risk reports on a regular basis. Perform business analysis to support business decisions and initiatives.  Provide Information Governance by maintaining a Metric Dictionary and calendar of key deliverables
  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
  • Leading and Mentoring – Support technology project implementation as a data subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success and your influence makes an impact. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have strong business acumen, including 4 to 8 years of working experience, preferably with 2 years of consulting experience. A university degree is required (Engineering, Computer Science or Business preferred) with an MBA being nice to have. A developed working knowledge of the IT industry is essential. Operations Risk experience is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Agile Methodologies, Change Management, Data Analytics (Inactive), Demonstrating Business Acumen (Inactive), Driving Vision and Purpose (Inactive), ITIL (Inactive), Management Consulting, Managing Relationships (Inactive), Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Word, Problem Solving, Taking a Global Perspective (Inactive)
